SumColumns

Returns a vector of the summation of the matrix columns

\begin{equation} A = \begin{bmatrix} -1 & 2 \\ 3 & -4 \end{bmatrix}, B = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & 4 \\ 6 & 8 \end{bmatrix}, C = \begin{bmatrix} -1 \\ 3 \end{bmatrix}, D = \begin{bmatrix} -1 & 3 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}

SumColumns(Matrix) = Vector

\begin{equation} SumColumns(A) = \begin{bmatrix} 2 & -2 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}

\begin{equation} SumColumns(B) = \begin{bmatrix} 8 & 12 \end{bmatrix} \end{equation}

SumColumns(Vector) = ERROR

\begin{equation} SumColumns(C) = ERROR \end{equation}

SumColumns(Scalar) = ERROR

\begin{equation} SumColumns(0) = ERROR \end{equation}
